DataElement.preferredName: BF-Diary Assessing OIC Past 24 Hours Pain Felt in Abdomen Because Constipation Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much, in the past 24 hours, pain they felt in their abdomen because of constipation, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation Past 24 Hours Quantity Pain Felt in Abdomen Because of Constipation Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to capture relevant patient information regarding opioid-induced constipation in a clinical trial setting. Three modules record information on bowel movements, symptoms experienced, and treatments used to relieve constipation._The 24 hour period occurring just before the present time._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A question about how much pain an individual felt in their abdomen because of constipation._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation (BF-Diary)
In the past 24 hours, how muc
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past 24 hours, how much pain did you feel in your abdomen because of constipation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
